intro: Erigeron sulcatus, commonly known as the grooved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and prairies. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron sulcatus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
